Articles.Content:
Well, hooray, I've created a drone that could, with Module Fuel System, could perform stunt such as the pitch-180. I have not yet tested it on a game without Module Fuel System.

So yeah, here is some story background:

After the September, 2001 K.D. on Kerbin City, the Kerbal government took action. The KSA (Kerbal Security Agency) stores thousands of datas. Recently, however, it was leaked. The government decided that they should discover the leaker. The Leaker was said to be seen on Kerbal Space Center. The government decided to use a drone to attack the KSC, to scare the Leaker from the KSC. They thought this for some good reasons: 1 is that they do not have to waste a pilot on a suicidal mission; 2 is that small planes are more likely to be ignored. So there they are, cranking the plane up. The first attempt, however, due to what KSA called "technical difficulties" the drone crashed; the second attempt ended with several crashing, creating an artificial earthquake; last attempt, the drone is almost at the mission control when stunts begin to settle. The drone crashed due to stall and what KSA called "performing stunts".

Here is the finished product of the drone I've used to (or attempted to anyway) bomb KSC:

(I have no idea why it can't contain its will to do stunts when I have Modular Fuel System installed... )

Download link: https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B4tG_PxGhuGIMnFlOTlSTTlvcms/edit?usp=sharing

Tested to be able to perform stunts in KSP 0.21.1 with Modular Fuel System. NOT tested to be able to perform stunts in KSP 0.21.1 with stock resource config. No guarantees, though. And yes, the plane is stock. Entirely.

Dependencies: None, otherwise why should I call it a stock craft?

More Out of It: Though it is not a dependency, Modular Fuel System helps me get most of the stunts out.

Happy stunting!

Edited August 30, 2013 by Designer225
